title.default: SAP AI Ethics Impact Assessment v0.1

html.default:
This is a work in progress. It is based on the Government of Canada's Algorithmic Impact Assessment, which is an open source project released under the MIT licence.

What is the Algorithmic Impact Assessment?

The AIA is a questionnaire designed to help you assess and mitigate the impacts associated with deploying an automated decision system. The AIA also helps identify the impact level of your automated decision system. The questions are focused on your business processes, your data, and your system design decisions.

How does it work?

The questionnaire asks you around 60 questions related to your business process, data and system designed decisions. The results will demonstrate your impact level.

Where can I find out why my system was rated a certain level?

When you complete the questionnaire, a detailed results page will be displayed. You can print it or save it as PDF.

Can I save my responses and complete the questionnaire later?

Yes. When you want to save your progress, click on the 'Save' button at the top of the window and save the JSON file (machine readable structure text document) to your local folders. If you want to continue where you left off, click on the 'Choose file' button and select your saved JSON file.

Do you store my answers?

No. We don't store your responses and data only remains within your browser's local storage. Feel free to use this tool as many times as you need along the development of your system.

All data will be deleted if you click on the button 'Start over'

text.default: Image and object recognition: Analyzing very large data sets to automate the recognition, classification, and context associated with an image or object.
Text and speech analysis: Analyzing large data sets to recognize, process, and tag text, speech, voice, andÂ make recommendations based on the tagging
Risk assessment: Analyzing very large data sets to identify patterns and recommend courses of action and in some cases trigger specific actions
Content generation: Analyzing large data sets to categorize, process, triage,Â personalize, and serve specific content for specific contexts
Process optimization & workflow automation: Analyzing large data sets to identify and anomalies, cluster patterns, predict outcomes or ways to optimize; and automate specific workflows

De-Risking And Mitigation Measures
Will the audit trail identify the authority or delegated authority identified in legislation?
Will the system provide an audit trail that records all the recommendations or decisions made by the system?
Will all the key decision points identifiable in audit trail?
Will all key decision points within the automated system's logic be linked to the relevant legislation, policy or procedure?
Will you maintain a log detailing all of the changes made to the model and the system?
Will the audit trail clearly set out all decision points made by the system?
Could the audit trail generated by the system be used to help generate a notification of the decision (including a statement of reasons or other notification) where required?
Will the audit trail identify precisely which version of the system was used for each decision it supports?
Will the audit trail show who the authorized decision-maker is?
Will the system be able to produce reasons for its decisions or recommendations when required?
Will there be a process in place to grant, monitor, and revoke access permission to the system?
Will there be a mechanism to capture feedback by users of the system?
Will there be a recourse process planned or established for clients that wish to challenge the decision?
Will the system enable human override of system decisions?
Will there be a process in place to log the instances when overrides were performed?
Will the audit trail include change control processes to record modifications to the system's operation or performance?
Will you prepared a concept case to the Government of Canada Enterprise Architecture Review Board?
Procedural Fairness
